issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Below is the message which i receive when i try to upload a new apk to beta group

You uploaded an APK with an invalid signature (learn more about signing). Error from apksigner: ERROR (Jar signer WFLMOBIL.RSA): JAR signature META-INF/WFLMOBIL.RSA uses digest algorithm 2.16.840.1.101.3.4.2.1 and signature algorithm 1.2.840.113549.1.1.1 which is not supported on API Levels [[14, 17]]

below warnings when creating the apk
[WARN] :   The selected alias "wflmobile" uses the "SHA256withRSA" signature algorithm which will likely have issues with Android 4.3 and older.
[WARN] :   Certificates that use the "SHA1withRSA" or "MD5withRSA" signature algorithm will provide better compatibility.

SHOULD I CHANGE THE SIGNATURE ALGORITEM? IF YES HOW?!!
Full titanium

[INFO] :   Package location: /Users/boaz/Desktop/Titanium/APK/World Fleet.apk
[INFO] :   Project built successfully in 38s 305ms
fields.summary: Cant upload apk to play store beta group - Critical!!! need to upload a new version ASAP

comments.body:
Hi,
Thanks for reaching us. What version of TiSDK do you have? 
 Please try to upload APK to play store using latest SDK 6.1.1.GA and let us know how it goes.

Regards,
Aminul

Hi,

I can't use the latest SDK because i'm using GCM 'modulenet.iamyellow.gcmjs' for android push notifications
and its not supported for SDK >=6

Currently i'm using  SDK 5.5.1.GA
[~boaz@e-drivetech.com] You need to re-generate your {{keystore}} to use {{SHA1withRSA}} instead of {{SHA256withRSA}} for compatibility with lower Android versions.
Hello [~boaz@e-drivetech.com], Do you still having the issue. Did you follow the guide that Gary gave?

There is a 6.x fork for this module: https://github.com/tdtsh/gcm.js/tree/master/android/dist

You can also go into the _build.js (mobilesdk/linux/6.0.1.GA/android/cli/commands/_build.js) and go to line ~4215 where it says:
{{var sigalg =...}} and change it to {{var sigalg =  'MD5withRSA'}}
You will still see the warning but it will use MD5 (or SHA1) with your key. I have a SHA256 key too and use this method to be compatible to older devices.
Hello [~boaz@e-drivetech.com], Whats is your update on the issue?
